intro: Hieracium macroconoides, commonly known as the large-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces achene seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. Hieracium macroconoides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
